page.title: 01BECKWITHSHAW AREA
page.content: The area is a rural one on the western edge of Harrogate divided into two halves by Oak Beck and its valley which rises at Ten Acre Reservoir.Land cover is predominantly pasture for both cows and sheep.These being raised for milk,wool and meat.There are three centres of population.The village of Beckwithshaw,the Army Apprentice's College(Uniacke Barracks)and staff quarters and Queen Ethelburga's School.There are also fourteen scattered farms.The main occupation in this area is farming with those who live in Beckwithshaw going out of the village to work.The area has few amenities just two pubs,two schools,a church and a village institute.People use Harrogate for most things.
